perturbation.original_text: As of the VNBJ Closing, except as expressly set forth in this Amendment, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBJ, all rights and obligations with respect to VNBJ under the JV Agreement shall terminate and all references to "Company" or "Companies" in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBZ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires.
perturbation.changed_text: As of the VNBJ Closing, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBJ, some rights and obligations with respect to VNBJ under the JV Agreement shall terminate and all references to "Company" or "Companies" in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBZ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by removing the 'except as expressly set forth in this Amendment' clause and changing 'all rights and obligations' to 'some rights and obligations'. This contradicts Article 2, which explicitly states that certain D&O indemnification obligations continue notwithstanding Article 1.1. This creates uncertainty regarding which rights and obligations terminate upon the VNBJ Closing, specifically in relation to D&O indemnification.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.

perturbation.original_text: Except as expressly set forth in this Amendment and notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in the JV Agreement (including Section 9.3.11 (Termination and Survival)), (a) effective as of the later of the VNBJ Closing and the VNBZ Closing, the JV Agreement shall terminate in its entirety with respect to the Veoneer Parties and (b) after the later of the VNBJ Closing and the VNBZ Closing, the Veoneer Parties shall cease to be a party to the JV Agreement and shall have no further obligations with respect thereto.
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding anything to the contrary contained in the JV Agreement (including Section 9.3.11 (Termination and Survival)), (a) effective as of the later of the VNBJ Closing and the VNBZ Closing, the JV Agreement shall terminate in its entirety with respect to the Veoneer Parties, except for ongoing liabilities, and (b) after the later of the VNBJ Closing and the VNBZ Closing, the Veoneer Parties shall cease to be a party to the JV Agreement and shall have no further obligations with respect thereto.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by removing the 'Except as expressly set forth in this Amendment' clause and adding 'except for ongoing liabilities'. While Article 1.d clarifies some liabilities that survive termination, the phrase 'ongoing liabilities' is vague and undefined, which contradicts the specific exceptions outlined in Article 1.d. It creates uncertainty about what constitutes an 'ongoing liability' and whether it aligns with or expands beyond the liabilities stated in Article 1.d. The specific survival of liabilities is now ambiguous.
perturbation.contradicted_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the termination of the JV Agreement with respect to VNBJ, VNBZ or the Veoneer Parties shall not release any Veoneer Party or any Nissin Party from liability for the breach of any of its representations, warranties, covenants or agreements set forth in the JV Agreement that arise prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.

perturbation.original_text: This Amendment shall only become effective upon the VNBJ Closing with respect to Article 1.1 and the VNBZ Closing with respect to Article 1.2, and shall terminate without any force or effect in the event that the VNBJ SPA and the VNBZ SPA are terminated in accordance with the terms thereof.
perturbation.changed_text: This Amendment shall only become effective upon either the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, prioritizing whichever occurs first, and shall terminate without any force or effect in the event that the VNBJ SPA and the VNBZ SPA are terminated in accordance with the terms thereof.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces an in-text contradiction by changing the effectiveness condition. Originally, the amendment's articles have staged effectiveness based on each specific VNBJ and VNBZ closings. The new amendment states this amendment becomes effective after only one of the company closings, creating ambiguity of how each article is working during that specific time of transition, contradicting the intentions of staged effectiveness as originally mentioned. This creates uncertainty because, as defined in Article 1 a. and b. , the effectiveness of each article becomes contradictory.
perturbation.contradicted_text: As of the VNBJ Closing, except as expressly set forth in this Amendment, the JV Agreement shall immediately cease to have any application or effect with respect to VNBJ, all rights and obligations with respect to VNBJ under the JV Agreement shall terminate and all references to "Company" or "Companies" in the JV Agreement (either in the body of the JV Agreement or its schedules and other attachments) shall read and be interpreted to mean VNBZ and/or ANRA except as the context otherwise requires.
